fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to copy users from Lookup object to a multi-user picker Jira field when multiple objects with multiple users are returned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an object type that contains a user attribute and can store multiple users 
# Create a few objects
# Create an automation rule that runs an object lookup 
# And then copy the users stored in these object to a multi-user picker field like Approvers

h3. Expected Results
You are able to copy the users 

h3. Actual Results
You are able to copy the users when there is a single object returned with multiple users set.
You are able to copy the users when there are multiple objects returned with single users set in each one of them.
You are  NOT able to copy the users and there are multiple objects returned and at least one of them contains more than one user
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at this time
fields.summary: Not able to copy users from Lookup object to a multi user picker Jira field

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

On Cloud, there is no way to allow an Insight Custom field to refer to a Parent Insight Custom field.
h3. Suggestion

Add "Filter Issue Scope" configuration to Insight Cloud, to allow for other Insight custom fields to be referenced as parent fields.
fields.summary: Add "Filter issue scope" configuration to Insight Cloud

fields.description:
h3.  
{panel:title=Update 3 August 2021}
This capability completed rollout at the end of July. If you are looking for how to migrate data from Insight Cloud to JSM Insight Cloud please follow the guide: [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/migrate-insight-cloud-to-insight-in-jira-service-management/]

Thank you all for your support. 
{panel}
h3.  
{panel:title=Update 15 June 2021}
Development is continuing on this functionality listed below. We underestimated the work require to deliver the experience needed and as such have both invested more developer headcount into this ticket and moved the delivery date. 

We now aim to deliver this capability before the *end of July, 2021.*
{panel}
{panel:title=Update 20 April 2021}
We have kicked off work to deliver a *schema export and import* capability to ease the process of migrating data from the Insight Cloud app to the Insight feature as part of JSM. This will replace the following steps included on the [Migrate Insight Cloud to Insight in Jira Service Management|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/migrate-insight-cloud-to-insight-in-jira-service-management/] documentation:
 # Export object types from Insight for Cloud app
 # Copy references, statuses, and roles
 # Import object types into Insight in Jira Service Management
 # Reimport data to link references

We aim to deliver this capability before the end of June, 2021.

Please note that the remaining steps on [Migrate Insight Cloud to Insight in Jira Service Management|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/migrate-insight-cloud-to-insight-in-jira-service-management/] documentation (i.e. copy automations, copy asset type configurations etc) will still need to be carried out manually. 
{panel}
h3.  
h3. Problem Definition

After the new launched JSM Insight Cloud app, more user will need to migrate to the app from Insight plugin as the plugin will be deprecated on 31st March 2022. It will be best if there's an easy tool to migrate them without using the CSV/JSON import.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create an easy migration tool to migrate data from Insight plugin to JSM Insight
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment. Admin need to export the data from Insight plugin and manually import to JSM Insight Cloud using the steps in [Migrate Insight Cloud to Insight in Jira Service Management|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/migrate-insight-cloud-to-insight-in-jira-service-management/] documentation.
fields.summary: Create a tool to migrate data from Insight Cloud plugin to JSM Insight Cloud app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, for user attributes, the data must use account id value. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if the admin can use "Full Name" instead for an easier process to import user attributes.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround at the moment. Admin can get user Account Id from "Export User" file at User Management and update the CSV file accordingly.
fields.summary: Allow to use user "Full Name" when import user attribute in Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing issues as agents, we can't see the customer status as what we had in the old issue view

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 10.38.56 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the Customer status field to the new issue view.

h3. Why is it important

For organizations that have complex and intertwined workflows of which the customer does not need to be aware; however, agents need to know what status the customer is seeing when discussing issues with them.
fields.summary: As an agent I would like to see the Customer status in agent view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you modify the *Viewing Permissions* of a Space in Project, it will also modify the *Viewing Permissions* of the same Space in all the other Projects where the Space was linked to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Service Projects
# Go to *Project Settings > Knowledge base*
# Link the same *Space* on both Projects
# Modify the *Viewing Permissions* in one of those two Projects

h3. Expected Results
The changes should apply only for the Project where the *Viewing Permissions* were modified.

h3. Actual Results
The *Viewing Permissions* of both Projects are modified:
 [^2021-04-16_14-24-15.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing Permissions of a Space linked to multiple Projects is shared between all the linked Projects

fields.description:
If a customer who created a ticket via email has a Display Name within their email information, Jira adds that to the Customer object created.

From then on, Jira hides the email and displays that Display Name instead.

Suggestion: Add an option to show the email address as well.

Example: When adding a customer as a Request Participant, I'd like it to say "Bob Lastname (bob.lastname@emailserver.com)" instead of just "Bob Lastname".
fields.summary: Customer Email Display

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user who has a Customer role in a service management project has other roles too in the same project (like Service Desk Team, Administrator, or any other roles) and creates a new ticket in the project through '*Create*' button in the Jira/Agent view, he won't be getting any Customer Notifications like issue created, issue commented, etc.,
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Give Customer role to a Jira user who's added to a JSM project
 # Create a ticket in the project through '*Create*' button in the Jira/Agent view (make sure it has a valid request type)
 # Add a comment to the issue from a different user/agent of the project

h3. Expected Results

The reporter should be getting customer notifications.
h3. Actual Results

No customer notification is sent to the reporter of the ticket

+Note+: If an agent creates a ticket on behalf of this user through Jira, he gets a customer notification
fields.summary: Customer notification not sent on issues with a valid request type if the reporter raises it through Jira

fields.description:
Currently, by design, all the customer invite emails include the logo and "Powered by Jira Service Management" text in the footer of the email.

Even if the template does not has it, these are still included in the invite email.

It would be better to have an option to remove this from the "Customer Invite" email just like we can do for other customer notifications
fields.summary: Allow customization of footer of "Customer invite" email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Removing an object in Insight will remove the value from the issue view after refreshing the page, but the field is not actually empty until you choose to set it to a different object or set it to EMPTY
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # To verify this create an automation rule that runs manually from the issue
 # Choose the condition to check if the insight field is empty
 # Then add an action to add to the audit log "field is empty"
 # Run the rule on an issue that has an object on the target insight field
 # Go to Insight and delete that object (set on the insight field in the issue view)
 # Go back to the issue, refresh the page and notice that the object is removed from the field.
 # Run the rule again

h3. Expected Results

The rule would audit the field is empty
h3. Actual Results

The rule will fail
fields.summary: Deleteing an Insight object does not remove the value from the Insight field in the database

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not able to select an object on issue view when Filter scope contains ORDER BY
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight object type custom field
 # To the filter scope if Insight object, add an IQL that includes the ORDER BY clause:
{noformat}
Objecttype ="Phone" ORDER BY label
{noformat}

 # Associate the custom field with an issue type and try to add the object for the issue

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to set the object in the object custom field.
h3. Actual Results

You can browse the objects, but when you try to select an object you receive the following error:
{quote}We couldn't retrieve the Insight object details
 Refresh the page and try again
{quote}
h3. Notes

In the developer console we receive the following error that suggests that it happens because, while editing the object type custom field, there is an additional AND statement included at the end of the IQL mentioned in the Filter scope, and that causes the invalid syntax for IQL:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"customfield_16718":"IQL \"objectSchemaId = 2 AND  Objecttype =Phone ORDER BY label AND (objectId IN (179))\" has invalid syntax at position  with error message \"extraneous input 'AND' expecting {<EOF>, ' '}\""}}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Remove the ORDER BY clause from the filter scope IQL
fields.summary: Not able to select an object on issue view when Filter scope contains ORDER BY

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating import configuration in Insight it doesn't save if it used a wrong date syntax. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Insight
# Click *Configure* for one of the object schema
# Go to *Import*
# Click *Create Configuration*
# Choose *CSV*
# The update the configuration with date as below :-
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-16 at 12.27.43 pm.png|thumbnail! 
# Click *Next*
# Upload the file and click *Save Import Configuration*

h3. Expected Results
It should return error and mention about the date format are wrong
 
h3. Actual Results
Doesn't show any error and the configuration not save on the import configuration page.

h3. Workaround

No workaround. Make sure the user update the date format correctly. As per my example , it should be dd/MMM/yy. 

h3. Note
It also happen when edit the import configuration , using the wrong date syntax doesn't return error , it just ignore and not save it.
fields.summary: When creating import configuration in Insight it doesn't saved if it used a wrong date syntax

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Automation, when user use "Create Object" action and already saved an object type , it changed when the user goes back to edit mode. It automatically changed to the first object type in the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to global automation
# Create a rule
# Choose *Issue Create* trigger and *Create Object* action
# Choose the schema and object type. Choose the object type that not the first in the list
 # Then , Save it.
# Goes back to "Create Object" action to trigger it

h3. Expected Results
The previous setting remains
h3. Actual Results
The object type changed to the first object type in the list. It doesn't save automatically but it changed at the edit mode. 

Here are the screenrecording :-

 [^Recording #9.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

No workaround , but can ignore it and don't click *Save*. It will goes back to the orginal setting.
fields.summary: When using "Create Object" action automation, the saved object type changed to the first object type in the list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A change has been made in which when a reporter is added as a watcher they will only get internal notifications. 
[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-notifications-do-my-customers-and-service-desk-team-receive/]

Because of this, tickets in which the reporter who is also a watcher in the ticket, are not sending CSAT Surveys even when the option is enabled. 

(The survey is sent on the customer notification for the resolution - which is now not sent in this case) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket and add the reporter as a watcher
 # Resolve the issue
 # Check the reporter email - no CSAT survey

h3. Expected Results
CSAT survey being sent

h3. Actual Results
No CSAT survey is sent

h3. Workaround
Remove the reporter from the watcher list before resolving the ticket
fields.summary: CSAT survey not being sent when reporter is added as a watcher

fields.description:
Currently, the customer organizations are shared across JSM projects.

It would be beneficial to have an option to restrict certain organizations to a particular project. This would help us to better manage the customers for a particular project.
fields.summary: Allow Organizations to be restricted at a project level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Connected Jira tickets filter is hardcoded to include only unresolved tickets. This filter should mimic the behavior in Insight server version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to JSM and into Insight
 # Select any object that has is connected to issues in Jira
 # Observer the Connected Jira issues filter on the right hand side

h3. Expected Results

The filter should be changed from unresolved to other JQL filters.
h3. Actual Results

The filter is hardcoded to unresolved filter only
h3. Workaround

Setup manual JQL filters (you can use IQL inside JQL as well) and save the filters in Jira with the objectType name
fields.summary: Users cannot change the Connected Jira tickets filter in Insight

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 26 April 2021}
This feature is currently in development. We will be supporting the same methods as those that exist for the [Insight Cloud marketplace app|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/REST+API]. 
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The new Insight JSM Premium Cloud has no documented REST API that can be utilised by users. It would be useful for Insight admins to manage objects and attributes in Insight via API.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement and document REST APIs that can be used by users to manage data in Insight JSM Premium Cloud
fields.summary: REST API for Insight JSM Premium Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the [Insight Macro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216074/insight-macro-for-confluence?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] is only available for the Insight server and DC Confluence.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide Insight Macro for reporting/visualizing in Confluence cloud that can pull Insight data from JSW/JSM Cloud.
h3. Workaround

take a look at using our Insight cloud APIs to build on such integration: [The new Insight API & help us decide future integration|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/The-new-Insight-API-amp-help-us-decide-future-integrations/ba-p/1702327]
fields.summary: Provide Insight Macro for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the "m" shortcut, the comment focus starts properly on internal note, but then shifts to "Reply to customer" when the user types or pastes information

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a JSM ticket
 # Press letter 'M'
 # The comment section will expand and your comment will be set as an internal comment
 # Start typing the comment

h3. Expected Results
As per this ticket implementation [JSDCLOUD-1733|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1733] the default behavior should be to add an internal comment.

h3. Actual Results
When you start typing that flips the comment tab to a public one and users might expose internal data if they don't pay attention to that.

h3. Workaround
Users that are familiar with this feature might disable their shortcuts to avoid any confusions and sharing undesired information:
{quote}
# The Help  !https://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/emoticons/help_16.png|width=16,height=16!  menu (in the top right of the navigation) and clicking 'Keyboard shortcuts'
 # Or by using the existing shortcut to bring up the keyboard shortcuts dialog (Shift + ?). _Note: If you disable the shortcuts, you won't be able to reopen the dialog via Shift + ?_
!disable_shortcuts.png|thumbnail!
{quote}

h3. Notes
For users looking to have a shortcut to add public notes please stay tuned on [JSDCLOUD-9487|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9487].
fields.summary: When using the "m" shortcut, the comment focus starts properly on internal note, but then shifts to "Reply to customer" when the user types or pastes information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When comparing attributes of an object using a mathematical operator, the below IQL works:
{noformat}
"Number1" = 1
"Number1" < 2
{noformat}
This IQL does not
{noformat}
"Number1" = "Number2"
"Number1" > "Number2"
{noformat}
Because Insight always expects a value after the operator instead of another attribute name.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Mathematical operations to work with integer variables in IQL so that object attributes can be compared
fields.summary: Mathematical operations to work with integer variables in IQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The SLA trigger can often timeout when performing a JQL query to see which issues had past the given threshold. This prints the error SocketException: Socket closed to the audit log.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup up an Automation rule
 # Use SLA threshold based trigger
 # Publish the rule

h3. Expected Results

The trigger should work consistently. A retry mechanism should be in place whenever the trigger fails.
h3. Actual Results

The trigger may face a timeout when performing a JQL query to see which issues had past the given threshold.

The below exception is thrown in the audit log
{noformat}
Error running JQL search to find issues breaching SLA
------ SocketException : Socket Closed
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Create a custom field called "sla_breached" and configure it on the service project.

 * Setup a legacy automation rule, whenever the sla breaches and edit the custom field sla_breached ant set any value.

 * Setup a new automation rule, whenever the sla_breached field changes, execute the required action.
fields.summary: SLA threshold based trigger fail with SocketException

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

SLA isn't stop/paused if the condition is swapped from Start to stop condition, and stop to pause condition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the following SLA configuration (status can be any status):
 ** Start: Issue created, status = "Waiting for Support"
 ** Pause: Leave it empty
 ** Stop: Status = "In Progress"
 # Create an issue and transition it to "Waiting for Support" > "In Progress" > "Waiting for support"
 ** This will record an SLA cycle (/)
 # Change the SLA configuration to the following:
 ** Start: Issue created,
 ** Pause: Status = "In Progress"
 ** Stop: status = "Waiting for Support"
 # This should recalculate existing tickets
 # Transition the issue to "In Progress"
 ** This should pause the SLA of the current issue, but it isn't (x)
 # Transition the issue to "Waiting for Support"
 ** This should stop the SLA of the current issue, but it isn't (x)

h3. Expected Results

SLA is paused/stop as per the updated SLA configuration
h3. Actual Results

SLA is *not* paused/stop as per the updated SLA configuration and keeps on running.
h3. Workaround

Run force re-calculation:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-management-are-missing-or-disappear-954252774.html]
fields.summary: SLA isn't stop/paused if the condition is moved from Start to Stop condition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time we can't change the format of date and DateTime attributes. The configuration set in the look and feel section of Jira or the Advanced configuration is not followed by the Insight. 
 !image (21).png|thumbnail! !image (22).png|thumbnail! !image (23).png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to set format for date and datetime attributes OR to honour the Jira date time settings
fields.summary: Ability to set format for date and datetime attributes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, we can only link 20 objects to a single Jira issue. When trying to link more than 20 objects we receive following message: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Some customers are looking to link more than 20 issues per Jira issue
fields.summary: Ability to link more than 20 objects to a single Jira issue

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 19 April 2021}
It is our current decision not to support multiple types of Insight custom fields, but to offer enhanced configuration capabilities within the one, existing Insight custom field ("Insight object/s"). We will be developing "Filter issue scope" config support, which will address the problem outlined in this ticket. Details of this can be found here: [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9894|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9894]
{panel}
h3. Problem description

On Cloud, there is no *Referenced Insight Custom Field* type. It will be best to have this in Cloud to allow the field to refer to a Parent field.
h3. Suggestion

Add "Referenced Insight Custom Field" type to Insight Cloud
fields.summary: Add "Referenced Insight Custom Field" type to Insight Cloud

fields.description:
Hi team!


I would like to suggest show time in the last update column in the Customer portal, because at this time just date is shown.

 

!image-2021-04-12-19-47-58-219.png!
fields.summary: Last update shows date and time on Customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Previously, at Insight plugin, it allow wiki style for *Textarea* attribute type value. However, at JSM Insight Cloud, it only allow normal text

h3. Suggested Solution
Add wiki style for *Textarea* attribute . Below are the difference between Insight plugin and JSM Insight Cloud :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-13 at 10.53.28 am.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-13 at 9.55.14 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Enable wiki style for "Textarea" attribute value in Insight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At Insight , when uploading or executing import , it return error below :-

{noformat}
NotFoundInsightException: Could not find import source with id: null
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare the CSV file or export from Insight plugin
 # Then , click *Insight > View all Object Schema*
# Click *Configure* for the object schema you would like to import
# Click *Import > Create Configuration*
# Choose CSV
# Fill in the details and click *Next*
# Upload the file


h3. Expected Results
File uploaded successfully and there's no error display

h3. Actual Results
File uploaded successfully , but it return error :-
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-13 at 9.37.01 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround. May Ignore the error.
fields.summary: When uploading or importing CSV to Insight , it return error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, we can only create an empty object schema.
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be good to provide the ability to create sample objects schema like just like in the Insight server:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

This will help customers to get started easily with the Insight features without the need to add new data
h3. Workaround

There are some object type CSV files that you can access and import in one of your object schemas using the steps mentioned in [Importing CSV files|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/import-a-csv-file-into-insight/#Importing-CSV-files]

Direct link to access the CSV files: [Download|http://10.9.30.204:8090/download/attachments/33466751/101_Only_Object_Schema.zip?version=1&modificationDate=1554479584440&api=v2]
fields.summary: Ability to create sample object schema

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When configuring Queues on a Jira Service Management project and instead of a JQL we use a filter for that queue, that has an *ORDER BY* clause, the tickets are not displayed accordingly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter with the ORDER BY clause in it.
 # Open a Jira Service Management project and create a new *Queue*.
 # Instead of a JQL use the filter that was created in Step 1.

h3. Expected Results
The queue should display ticket according to the ORDER BY clause mentioned in the Filter.

h3. Actual Results
The queue does not respect the ORDER BY clause in the filter.

h3. Workaround
When configuring the Queue, mention the ORDER BY clause separately along with the filter.
Example: 
{code:java}
filter = "Filter for SDT 2" ORDER BY created 
{code}
fields.summary: Queue doesn’t respect the ORDER BY clause in the filter.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Referenced object value for an object is not displayed on the issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 object types with the same schema, OT1 ad OT2
# In OT1, add an attribute *RefObj* of type object that has a reference to the OT2
# Created objects in both the object types and add the value for *RefObj* for OT1 object type
# Create a new Insight object custom field and in the configuration make sure you add the *RefObj* attribute to the *Object attributes to display on issue view* section
# Now create an issue and select the object of OT1
# View the attributes of the selected object on the issue view 

h3. Expected Results
In the issue view, you can see all the attributes added to the *Object attributes to display on issue view* section with a value

h3. Actual Results
You can see all the attributes added to the *Object attributes to display on issue view* section with a value except for the *RefObj* attribute even though it has a value
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Referenced object value for an object is not displayed on the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Jira Service Management - team-managed (formerly next-gen)
# Go to a Request Type, select one in particular (Email requests, for example) and copy its workflows to the rest of the request types.
# Perform some changes to the workflow associated with "Email requests", and save. (At this point, the Email Requests' Workflow will differ from the rest of the request types)
# Go to another request type (for example: "Get IT Help") and perform some changes to its workflow > Save.
# Go back to the Workflow associated with "Email Requests"

h3. Expected Results

The workflow will be as you saved in step #3.

h3. Actual Results

The changes applied to the "Get IT Help" workflow will overwrite the "Email request" ones.
 
h3. Notes

- Any changed performed to workflows that have been copied from another one (Email requests, in this case) will overwrite other workflows.

h3.Workaround

The only workaround is to make sure that each request type uses its own workflow, that hasn't been copied from other active request types.

If you want to make sure that the "Email requests" workflow will not be overwritten by changes to other request types, proceed as follows:

# Create temporary request type.
# Copy the "Email requests" workflow to the temporary request type.
# Delete the temp request type. This will fix the "Email requests" workflow
fields.summary: Changes to Request Type's workflows (team-managed (formerly next-gen)) overwrite other workflows

fields.description:
I would like to automatically opt-in service desk customers for notifications if I add an organization.

Now the user needs to opt-in manually and we don't want that.

Alternative could be to allow Organizations or groups to be added as request participant.
fields.summary: Automatically opt-in Organization customer users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Gadgets do not display the value stored in the Insight object custom field
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JQL to filter a few issues that have a value in the Insight object custom field, save the JQL as a filter
 # On a Jira dashboard, add gadget *Filter Results* and select the filter created in step1
 # Select the Insight object field as one of the columns that you want to display

h3. Expected Results

In the gadget results, we can see the Insights object values selected
h3. Actual Results

The Insights object column is empty
 !image-2021-04-08-15-55-26-766.png|width=471,height=137!
h3. Workaround

The values are displayed correctly in the JQL result and JSM queues. So meanwhile use the JQL filters instead of gadgets to see the Insight information of these issues
fields.summary: Gadgets do not display the value stored in Insight object custom field

fields.description:
*Current behavior*
Currently, the Insight Discovery file has to be manually uploaded.

*Desired behavior*
It would be great to have the ability to automatically upload the file once the Discovery scan completes.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically upload the Insight Discovery

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, we do not have the attachments panel available to upload files to an object.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

This is only available with the Insight cloud app
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be good to have the attachment panel included in the new JSM so that the customers do not face any challenges when moving from the Insight cloud app to the new JSM+Insight
fields.summary: Provide attachment panel for Insight objects

fields.description:
*Issue*: In ServiceDesk Portal, there is no way to print the issue in same format as the customer sees when the issue is opened in the help center.

*Workaround and its limitations*: Use command *Ctrl+P* to print the page but here we lose the proper HTML and CSS formatting as shown in the below screenshot. This also includes the Browse content at the top which is not good.
!image-2021-04-07-13-41-31-319.png|width=182,height=91!



*Expected behavior:* There should be a native feature to print the issues from the ServiceDesk portal as we have a print and export feature in ServiceDesk for Agents.
fields.summary: Ability to print issues in proper format from Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 19 April 2021}
This suggestion is not being considered at this point in time for inclusion on the roadmap. If this changes, this ticket will be updated to reflect this new status.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, we do not have the *Insight object* available as a field in next-gen projects. This prevents the customers from using the new Insight features in a next-gen project
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

The customers want to use the new Insight features in next-gen projects. It will be nice to have the *Insight object* field available for next-gen projects
fields.summary: Ability to use the Insight object custom field with next-gen projects

fields.description:
All comments from different types are currently displayed in the same section, which can sometimes get confusing.

*Suggestion*
 Add the ability to display internal notes and public comments on separate tabs in the issue view.
fields.summary: Display internal notes and public comments separately

fields.description: Users can manage icons used in Insight by changing it's name or even deleting some of them as described on [Manage icons|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/manage-icons/] but it would be nice to have the option to upload new ones as well.
fields.summary: Add the ability to upload new Icons for Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When customer uses custom email account for Email Request and there is connection problem between JSM and customer email server (ie Microsoft Graph API), there will be lot of "noise" in the email logs. Although, JSM will pick up emails where it last connect, it could send different message to users.
*  !Screenshot 2021-04-06 at 8.36.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution

Improve the incoming email logs to reduce the "noise".
fields.summary: Improve incoming email logs when there is connection issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

On Cloud, the Insights custom fields don't have "Filter issue scope" and so users can't use placeholders.
h3. Suggestion

Add the ability to use placeholders on Insights custom fields
fields.summary: Add the ability to use placeholders on Insights custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary JSM REST API renders code formatted text within elements. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a JSM issue. # Add a comment that includes text that is formatted as code. e.g. "Comment with `code`." # Send a get request to https://\{some-tenant}/rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueKey}/comment?expand=renderedBody # Observe the returned `renderedBody.html` field. h3. Expected Results The `renderedBody.html` field formats the code section appropriately. In the above example, it should be similar to "Comment with code" or "Comment with 
code
". h3. Actual Results The `renderedBody.html` uses a tag for render code. For example, "Comment with code". h3. Workaround None
fields.summary: JSM REST API does not render code in comments formatted text properly.

fields.description:
Team-Managed projects are working really well for some of our departments, and the simplified administration is a huge benefit.

However, some service departments are only applicable to specific, internal groups within the organisation. Manually adding and removing customers isn't really workable, nor is opening the project to the whole organisation directory.

In Company-Managed projects, we can manage customers via group in the project settings. I understand that Team-Managed projects are meant to be agent-driven, but it's a big roadblock not being able to restrict an internal Service Management project to a specific group and having to manage customers manually for these purposes.

It could work just like inviting agents/team members, where agents can do it manually within the main project, but group based management is still available in the project settings.
fields.summary: Managing customers via directory group in Team-Managed projects

fields.description:
Hello,

I have been unable to find documentation for Insight error codes, and have yet to see anything but a 400 error so I am not sure what that means. Would it be possible to get the documentation updated for error codes for Insight Cloud?


Thanks,
Wade
fields.summary: Insight Error Code Documentation

fields.description: It would be helpful to create a secondary "Customer Admin" account, which would allow "Customer Admins" to see all tickets submitted by their organization, while simultaneously restricting the visibility of standard Customers to just their own tickets.
fields.summary: Include the ability to restrict "Share with Organization" customer permission to specific customers

fields.description:
Hi Team,

It would be great if you can support smart values for user fields such as Request participants so that we can retrieve an email from so custom field, summary, or even description and can use it in user fields like Reporter, Request participants or Watchers
fields.summary: Support smart values for user fields such as Request participants

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, as JIRA Service Management already allow multiple of spaces in knowledge based conifguration , it will be best to have option to limit KB suggestions at JIRA issue view by space to prevent unrelevant page suggested.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the option to set KB suggested in JIRA issue view by space.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability to limit knowledge based suggested in JIRA issue view based on space

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the CSAT comment is set to optional. It will be best to have option to set comment as *Required* for CSAT.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have option to set CSAT comment as required.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability to set CSAT comment as required

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Atlassian account Jira Service Desk customers received mention notification and click *View Issue* button , it didn't redirect to the issue page in Customer Portal , but it goes to Customer Portal Help Center.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Atlassian Account Jira Service Desk customer (Atlassian account without any application access)
# Create issue on behalf of the customer
# As agent , view issue via JIRA
# Mention the customer
# Customer will receive mention notification and click the *View Issue* to view the issue. For example the link will be :-
{noformat}
https://gohappyalways.atlassian.net/browse/ITSM-110?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiOTQ1NjJhNDhmYTc4NGRmMWI1OGEzYTM4YWVmZTQwNzgiLCJwIjoiaiJ9
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The link redirect to the issue in Customer Portal. For example :-

{noformat}
https://gohappyalways.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/ITSM-110
{noformat}


h3. Actual Results
You'll be redirected to the Help Center (https://site.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals)
 
h3.Workaround
- Access the ticket via "Requests" in the top-right corner of the screen.
- Use the *View Request* link from customer notification template that customer received when issue created and issue commented.
fields.summary: "View Issue" link redirection from mention notification email are not working to customer with Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Description

When the user is not considered an Agent on the service project, the user is not able to access Jira Service Management-specific features on that project. However, when they try to access the *Email requests* page, no feedback or error message appears to the user, instead, the page keeps loading and spinning forever.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if a feedback or error message be displayed to inform the users that they don't have permission to access the Email requests page.
fields.summary: The Email requests page should show an error message when the user doesn't have permission to access it

fields.description: Currently in the Jira app on my iPhone, when I look at the queues in our JSM projects I get a view that shows me all the available ones I can access along with a number of tickets in each queue. However if the total number in that queue is over 100 it merely states 99+ and not the actual number. Please can the app be improved so that it can show the actual number? Even just improving it to be able to show a 3 digit number would be much better than it is today (so it would then cap out at 999+).
fields.summary: iPhone JIRA app - allow queue view to show more than 2 digit numbers

fields.description:
Problem:

When a new custom email request is created in the email request and if the customers are not aware of the changes and still send an email to the old default email address. Customers need to be notified that this email id no longer exists.

Expected Resolution:

Add a feature for users to be notified if they are sending emails to the wrong email address.

Workaround :

Add an announcement in the customer portal
fields.summary: Send automated email response to customer when they try to create ticket from default email id which no longer exists

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

There are companies that would like to remove the option "Need to raise a request?" on JSM projects but the option is not available.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to disable the option "Need to raise a request?" from the knowledge article.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the option "Need to raise a request?" from the knowledge article

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user added to request participant and being set to inactive , it will automatically removed from "Request Participant" value and it was not updated in the issue history

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JSM issue
# Add user to request participant
# Go to User Management and set to inactive
# Go back to the issue, user being removed from the request participant field
# Check the issue history , no information about it.

h3. Expected Results
Issue history updated the user being removed.

h3. Actual Results
No issue history about it

h3. Workaround
At the moment , no workaround. You may verify the user if being set to inactive from the User Management or Audit log to confirm.
fields.summary: Updating user to inactive it automatically removed from Request Participants value and not updated the issue history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Portal request page status filter search does not display all the statuses belonging to the service desk
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Created request on BIG Kudos request type in Hello under service desk project "kudos"
 # The request created is displayed on request list  page  indicating right status "Awaiting Manager Approval"
 # Go to status filter search  , type "kudos" , you will see only 5 status and  Awaiting Manager Approval" is not shown in status filter drop down.
 # Try to search for  "Awaiting Manager Approval" in filter, Kudos project and the status is not shown in the drop down

h3. Expected Results

Awaiting Manager Approval" status should be shown in status filter drop down upon search.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Continue to use just the default status filtering " Any Status" "Open Status" "Closed Status" for filtering.
fields.summary: The Portal request page  status filter search does not display all the statuses belonging to the service desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you attempt to link or create a Jira ticket from inside an Opsgenie alert, you get an error saying "Unexpected error occurred". Screenshot of error shown below.

*Please Note:* This is NOT impacting all customers. Only few customers are impacted.

 

!image-2021-03-31-09-58-26-571.png|width=974,height=548!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Opsgenie alert
 # Try to link or create a Jira ticket from inside the Opsgenie alert.
 # You get the error as described

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to link or create a Jira ticket from inside the Opsgenie alert.
h3. Actual Results

The error is displayed as shown in the screenshot above
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error when linking or creating Jira ticket from inside an Opsgenie alert in JSM

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current [Insight api for imports|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/REST+API] is quite limited in terms of its features. As an Insight admin that needs to configure a large number of imports, it would be useful to be able to do this through API. That would also make it possible to update these configurations.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the functionality for the Insight import to be picked up from a flat-file. Admins would need to configure this file and update it if any changes need to be made.
h3. Notes

This request is dependent on the Insight REST API first being supported for JSM Premium Cloud: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9879
fields.summary: As an Insight admin I would like to have Insight api to create import configuration

fields.description:
In the Alerts page (`/alert/list`), I can select an alert, click `...`, then Add Tag, and a modal pops up...but, if the alert already has tags, those are not displayed in the input region. Then:

(i) It's not clear that the existing tags weren't deleted (my assumption at first)
(ii) It's not clear whether I have already applied a specific tag
fields.summary: Populate existing tags in Alerts page Add Tag modal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default, when customers with an Atlassian account (with no product access, just active on the site) access the site's URL (https://example.atlassian.net), they will be redirected to the portal URL so they can authenticate and access the portal.

However, when a [landing product is configured|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/set-your-sites-landing-product/], these customer accounts will face a message stating that they do not have access to the product on the site instead of being redirected to the portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure at least, a single customer account with site-access, but, no product access, like the example below:
!no_access.png|thumbnail!
# Make sure that this account has access to a Service Management project so the user should be able to access the portal and view it.
# As a site-admin, go to the site's administration and access the *Product access* part.
# There, under the *What you need to know* session, tap the *Change this setting* button and select a product.
# Have the customer accessing the site via its URL (example.atlassian.net)

(i) Although the default message states that the landing product is Jira, by tapping the option to change the default product, the dropdown will prompt you to select a product:

!default.png|thumbnail!

If you have already configured a product, after tapping this option, it will look like the following, already having the product selected:

!changed.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The user should be redirected to the portal.

h3. Actual Results
The user will face a message that they don't have access to the landing product:

{quote}
account@example.com doesn't have access to Jira/Confluence on example.atlassian.net
{quote}

h3. Workaround
The customer can directly access one of the following URLs to land on the portal:

* The portal URL.
* https://example.atlassian.net/jira (with the /jira context path added to the site's URL)
* The project URL (e.g. https://example.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/KEY)
fields.summary: Setting a landing product will not redirect customers to the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JSW issues don't render as hyperlinks on the Customer Portal for users who're not site&org admins.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as a a user who's not site&org admin.
 # Mention a JSW issue in a ticket.
 # View the request in the Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results

JSW issues should render as hyperlinks.
h3. Actual Results

JSW issues appear as plain text.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSW issues don't render as hyperlinks on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
This timezone is taken from Jira API.

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KyivNotKiev] for more details

!image-2021-03-29-09-42-56-168.png!
fields.summary: Timezone used in the capacity tracker should state "Europe/Kyiv", but not "Europe/Kiev"

fields.description: Would love it if there was some documentation on error codes from the Insight API. At this time everything returns a 400 error which is not very helpful when troubleshooting issues.
fields.summary: Insight Error Codes documentation

fields.description:
Hi team,

Schedule Start/End notifications are sent out as critical alert notifications, which is not an actionable event and it would be great to have the option to define what is a critical alert notification for the IOS app.

Thanks.

Kind regards, 
Darryl Lee
Opsgenie Support
fields.summary: Ability to define what is a Critical Alert for IOS

fields.description:
The ability to have a hierarchical custom field that represents the object types & objects in Insights (level 1 & level 2).

 

For example, this would provide the ability for a user to click the custom field & first select the object type followed by the object.
fields.summary: Insight - Hierarchical list custom field

fields.description: An example would be the user goes to the Jira Service Management portal & goes to one of the request types. On that page, there is a field showing the user's existing assets in Insight. They would also be able to select an asset e.g. if you needed a new phone, they could select the existing phone to be replaced.
fields.summary: Insight - Provide a way for users to see their existing assets

fields.description:
An example would be to have an Insight Asset Type containing the service catalog items e.g. Microsoft Laptop, Apple iPhone etc. Each item would have attributes e.g. cost, storage size, network capabilities. 

 

The user on the Jira Service Management portal would then be able to click on the service catalog field & essentially select each item they need & be able to see the configured attributes.

 

This is critical for onboarding staff as well as user-initiated IT asset update requests.
fields.summary: Insight - Provide functionality for an ITSM asset catalog

fields.description: There isn't an option to remove the default queues like Incidents, Problems, etc. from a new SM project. Can it be added? I want to be able to have a very slimmed down project and won't be using these queues for it. They are then a visual distraction.
fields.summary: Remove default queues in ITSM project

fields.description: Currently a custom field context applies to project + issue type.  Please provide ability to apply a customer field context to project + issue type + request type.  Or as alternative, provide a way to limit options in field context further for request type.
fields.summary: Ability to create or limit custom field context for project + request type

fields.description:
h3. Description
Add screen layout option to hide fields in custom tabs

h3. Description
In Jira Service Management we can configure the [Agent View|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-customer-request-form-and-issue-view-layout-for-a-request/] similar to the Issue Layout but we can't still rearrange the configuration for any other tabs besides the *General* one. 

As seen right below we can't drag-and-drop the fields as we can do in the "General" tab.
!image-2021-03-24-13-49-11-193.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to have the option to change the field's configuration like hiding when empty for custom tabs as well.
fields.summary: Add screen layout option to hide fields in custom tabs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently when a Major Incident is created in one project is reflected in all other projects. We would like the ability to create a Major Incident such that it only shows iin the project it was created in.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have multiple projects in JSM
 # Create a Major Incident in Project A

h3. Expected Results

The Major Incident only shows up in that Project and in Opsgenie
h3. Actual Results

The Major Incident shows up in all projects
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Create Major Incidents only for one Project

fields.description:
This suggestion is to provide a variant of [GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-issueidorkey-get] which accepts multiple issue IDs and/or keys. The benefits of this will likely be:
 * Improved performance
 * Simplified app code/development
 * Reduce likelihood of being rate limited
fields.summary: Get multiple requests by issue IDs and/or keys

fields.description:
+*to put it in a user story:*+

As a PM I want "EMPTY" to be a valid figure in the syntax of creating filters so I can create filters simply on definitions what i want to exclude without defining a specific inclusion of figures for the same field when it comes to searching tickets

 

+*Example:*+

*filter1:*

type = "Portfolio Initiative" AND (assignee = "my.name@company.com" OR reporter = "my.name@company.com") AND fixVersion != 2021Q3 AND fixVersion != 2021Q2

*filter2:*

type = "Portfolio Initiative" AND (assignee = "my.name@company.com" OR reporter = "my.name@company.com") AND fixVersion != 2021Q3 AND fixVersion != 2021Q2 OR type = "Portfolio Initiative" AND (assignee = "my.name@company.com" OR reporter = "my.name@company.com") AND fixVersion is EMPTY

*explanation*

If i use the filter1, to actually catch everything that is not concerning the current quarter, Jira won't show me tickets assigned to me with no fixVersion. Out if a logical perspective this seems to be a bug to me rather than a feature. Only by adding a complete definition with operator "OR" i'll catch the tickets with empty fixVersion.

So my conclusion is, that EMPTY is not included in 'any other fixVersion than 2021Q2 or 2021Q3'. For me, it seems to be more comfortable to see "EMPTY" as an equal figure to any other figure possible to fill the fixVersion field with.
fields.summary: syntax optimization for filters concerning empty fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Approver set using Insight Post function does not trigger an Approval required customer notification

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an Insight asset to the Create issue action in a workflow that requires approval after creating the issue
# Use an Insight post function to copy the user attribute of the Insight asset to the Approver field 
# Create an issue with an Insight object
# Issue gets created with the same user set as an approver

h3. Expected Results
The Approver also receives an email that the request requires their approval

h3. Actual Results
The Approver does not receive an email about the required approval, even though the legacy automation rule to trigger *Approval Required* customer notification is executed successfully.
 
h3. Notes
The customer can see the issue that requires their approval on the customer portal. It is caused due to the parameters in the endpoint insight is using to edit the approver field. Created a bug for the Insight team here: https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICC-82 

h3.Workaround
Use Automation for Jira to trigger an email to approvers when the issue is created.
fields.summary: Approver set using Insight Post function does not trigger an Approval required customer notification

fields.description:
*Summary*

When moving one issue from one service project to another, the "*Request Type*" value stays the same -- though in reality, the request type should show as 'None'

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a Service Desk ticket with a request type value
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-22 at 09.20.06.png|thumbnail! 

# Move the issue from one service project to a different service project

*Expected Results*

The request type value is empty.

*Actual Results*

The request type value has the same value as the previous issue type which is incorrect. If you change to "Old Issue View", it will show "No Match" for the request type, which is the expected outcome.

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-22 at 09.26.12.png|thumbnail! 

The customer portal view will show a blank request type.
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-22 at 09.27.41.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround:*

Set the request type on the issue again once the issue is moved.
fields.summary: Request Type shows incorrect value in New Issue View after moving from one service project to another

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Setting up an approval step using "Include approvers from service" causes issue description to be erased
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a [Service|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/create-a-service/] in an ITSM project and select a "Change approvers" group
 # Configure an approval workflow on the same project
 ## "Include approvers from service": "Affected Services"
 # Create a JSM ticket with the "Affected Services" created in step one.
 # In case required, transition the ticket to the approval step.
 # Edit ticket description(while still pending approval)

h3. Expected Results
The ticket description should be updated

h3. Actual Results
Then entire description is removed from the ticket and ticket history displays an entry saying that A4J has removed the value.
 !Screen+Recording+2021-03-19+at+05.07.30+PM.gif|width=550! 

h3. Notes
Removing the "Affected Services" value the issue does not happen.

h3. Workaround
None besides cleaning the value of "Affected Services".
fields.summary: Setting up an approval step using "Include approvers from service" causes issue description to be erased

fields.description:
We have a large number of Support users who require Service Desk Agent licenses in order to work on Service Management tickets.  Why do you not offer concurrent licensing?

We never have all agents logged in to Service Management at the same time, so it doesn't seem right to have to pay for the ones that aren't used very often.  

I understand you get more money if we have to license everyone, but please consider concurrent licensing for Service Management.  Even if you have to set a minimum number of licenses in order to use it (50 or 100).
fields.summary: Concurrent Licenses for Service Management

fields.description:
(I'm not sure if JSDCLOUD is the right project for this, but it seems to be where all of the opsgenie issues are so I'm following the crowd.)

 

The postmortem review stage of the Opsgenie incident management process is made unnecessarily clunky by the inability for reviewers to add comments to the postmortem document rather than making inline edits.  This can be somewhat addressed by exporting the postmortem to confluence, but (a) not all opsgenie users use confluence, and (b) the confluence export is a one-way export not a sync, so comments on the confluence document must be addressed in the postmortem and then the whole thing must be re-exported to confluence, which creates _two_ confluence documents linked to the PM (and linked transitively to all Jira issues).
fields.summary: Users should be able to add comments in the Opsgenie postmortem view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user is a part of both (group and the project role) entities of the filtering applied for a single user picker field, it is displayed twice on the customer portal of that field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom single user picker field.
# Apply user filtering of a *Group* and a *Project Role* to that field.
# Add that custom field to a Request form so that it is visible on the customer portal

Notice how if a user is added both to the Group and the Project Role, it is displayed twice on the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
A user added to both the entities should not be duplicated

h3. Actual Results
A user is duplicated

h3. Workaround
Remove the user from either the Group or the Project Role to
fields.summary: A user added in both (group and project role) is displayed twice on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, "Customer Invitation" email will only send to new customer in the instance. However , with the current ability to add JIRA user ( without JSM application access) as customer to the project by adding them to "Service Desk Customer" project role , they will not get invitation email as the project customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to have the option to send customer invitation email to this users.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability to send customer invitation email to user already have a JIRA account

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer Portal customisation does not work if the language to customise translations is set to English (UK)
h3. Environment

Jira Service Management customer portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the *Customer Portal -> Customize* tab, on the '*Select a language to customize translations*' option, select *English (UK)
 # Edit the *Front page title* and save it

h3. Expected Results

The changes will be saved and successfully configured.
h3. Actual Results

The changes can be saved but the changes will not be reflected on the portal
h3. Workaround

Select 'English (US)' as the language before making changes on the portal.

  !Screen Recording 2021-03-18 at 12.15.39.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Portal customisation does not work if the language to customise translations is set to English (UK)

fields.description:
Most users don't know or need to use the difference between Epic Name and Summary fields, and they express frustration at having to fill in both fields when creating an Epic.  Often times they don't fill in the same values in the two fields, again because they don't know or need to use the functionality that would require that.

I suggest that the Epic Name field be allowed to be set as optional and removed from create screens, and allow administrators to set up a workflow Post Function that would copy the value from Summary to Epic Name.  (Or vice versa, exchanging Epic Name and Summary fields in the previous scenario.)
fields.summary: Allow Epic Name to be optional and automatically populated from Summary value during creation

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Need separate Jira events for Private comments and Public comments added to the issue so that Admin can customize the notification for those events and the targetted audience

*Suggested Solution*

Create separate Jira events for Private comments and Public comments and thereby Jira notifications

*Why this is important*

Can customize notification for private and public comments

 *Workaround*

Use automation rule
fields.summary: Separate Jira notification for Private comments and Public comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment , user able to upload a new custom request type icon. However, there are no options to delete it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to have the option to delete if the user accidentally uploads the wrong images.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability to delete the custom request type icon

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Service report gadget show incorrect graph when Selecting "Past Year by Month". Only happens with the following scenario:
 * Timezone: Africa/Casablanca
 * Date Range: Past year by month

The above *doesn't affect the original report (only gadget)*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set timezone to Africa/Casablanca from Profile section
 # Have a JSM project and sample report
 # Create a dashboard and add "Service report gadget"
 ** Select one of the reports
 ** Date Range: *Past year by month*
 ** Save

h3. Expected Results

It shows until current month (ie. March)
 * !Screenshot 2021-03-17 at 12.09.31 AM.png|thumbnail!
 * !Screenshot 2021-03-17 at 12.12.37 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

It shows until last month (ie. Feb)
 * !Screenshot 2021-03-17 at 12.08.16 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Change the "Date Range" to *Past year by week*
 * Or, change to different timezone
fields.summary: Service report gadget show incorrect graph when Selecting "Past Year by Month"

fields.description:
Summary:
 Currently, there is no ability for the customers to mark the tickets as Starred or Favorite on the customer portal.

Expected behavior:
 There can be a column in the customer portal with a star to be selected. The customer can click on the star for those tickets whom they want to flag or make as favorite.
   !image-2021-03-16-20-16-53-893.png|width=97,height=71!
fields.summary: ability to mark the ticket as Star or Favorite on the customer portal

fields.description: Currently, when Opsgenie is connected or merged with JSM, Opsgenie is only linked directly from within JSM (via the 'Alerts' button in ITSM projects). This request is to add a link to connected Opsgenie accounts to the app switcher located in Atlassian products and the Atlassian cloud admin portal
fields.summary: Request for dedicated Opsgenie app link in app switcher for JSM merged/connected Opsgenie

fields.description:
Currently it's not possible to search assets like "パーソルイノベーション"  and "パーソルホールディングス" by the word like "イノベーション" and "ホールディングス".
It would be great if support fuzzy search in the linked asset field.
fields.summary: Support fuzzy search in the linked assets field

fields.description:
Currently only up to 10 options are shown in the linked assets field when searching it. It would be great that all of the options are shown and able to scroll it.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Increase the number of options shown in the linked assets when searching it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there's no option to add captcha in request form. The expected behaviour is the captcha will trigger when the customer creating a new issue. 

There's a case when customer spamming the customer portal by creating multiple issues repeatedly via customer portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to add captcha to the request form.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability to add Captcha in Customer Portal request form

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not able to sort data using Approvers' field from Jira Service Desk.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the advanced search in Jira.
 # Use a JQL similar to the one below:
{code:java}
ORDER BY Approvers
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Tickets are ordered based on Approvers' value.
h3. Actual Results

On UI the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
"An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search".
{noformat}
The below exception is thrown in our logs:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException: Attempted to perform non-db capable search in Vertigo mode
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.SearchModeExecutor.performPrimarySearch(SearchModeExecutor.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.SearchModeExecutor.lambda$getTimedResults$1(SearchModeExecutor.java:112)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None available at this time.
fields.summary: Not able to sort data using Approvers' field

fields.description:
Hello,

I was testing lookup issues in Jira automation when I found that priority lookup is not available in Jira automation. As it is one of the most essential parts of the issues, kindly add this as soon as possible.

Regards
fields.summary: lookup Issues in Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Previously agents able to view the satisfaction survey comment from the issue view by clicking at the satisfaction star. Now , it only display the date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Closed an issue to trigger the satisfaction survey
 # Update the survey and add a comment in the survey
# Open the issue in JIRA and click at the star

h3. Expected Results
The satisfaction survey result comment display at the issue view when agent click it.

h3. Actual Results
Only show the date :-
!Screen Shot 2021-03-12 at 4.12.42 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Check the comment at Satisfaction survey report.
fields.summary: Satisfaction survey comment not displaying in issue view when agent click  at the star

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the JSM Widget, there is no way to configure how search results are prioritised. The text search doesn't differentiate whether the word is inside the Request Type or if it's a Field resulting in unreliable searches.

For example: when the word "Order" is used for search, it lists every Request Type that has the word order as one of its fields but due to the widget only showing a limited amount of Request Types (See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-7910), the desired request type is not shown and unable to be selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a few request types (More than 3) with the word *Order* on it.
 * Create a few more different request types that have 'Order' fields in them
 * Create a Widget in your Service Desk project, turning on the options *Show all request Types in the Widget* and *Show Knowledge Base in the Widget*
 * Add the Widget code to a web page
 * Search the word Order - both complete words and incomplete words.

h3. Expected Results

The results should prioritise showing request types that have the search term on them.
h3. Actual Results

When the complete word "Order" is used for search, it lists every Request Type that has the word order as one of its fields and due to the widget being able to show a limited amount of request types, request types that are actually relevant to the search team aren't shown.
fields.summary: JSM Widget Search Prioritisation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
WYSIWYG editor for default description in request type configuration(Next-Gen) does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Next-Gen JSM project settings > Request types
 # Expand the description field
 # Under *Default description (optional)* add a custom text. Eg. Like a header or a "Bold" text.

h3. Expected Results
 # Values are rendered in the portal using the style defined
 !image-2021-03-11-12-29-12-143.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

While accessing the request in the portal the wiki markup is displayed.
 !image-2021-03-11-12-27-27-250.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Use plain text instead
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor for default description in request type configuration(Next-Gen) does not work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to add _Resolution_ column information in the Customer Portal request overview.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add _Resolution_ column information in Customer Portal request overview.
h3. Why this is important:

It would be nice to have a filter option on the portal for the customers so they could filter for resolution on closed tickets. This would avoid opening all the tickets and checking their resolution one by one.
fields.summary: resolution column in custom portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

When a field added in tab from screen configuration, and at the same it's added in "Request Form", then this field won't be shown in the tab as configured. Here are the steps:
# In screen configuration, add a new tab (let's name it with "Bear") and add a field (let's call it "Test")
# In project settings > Request type > Add "Test" CF under Request Form so that it displays in Portal
# Create a new issue from portal and fill up "Test" CF
# Back to Agent view, you notice that "Test" CF isn't shown under "Bear" tab, but it's in "General"/ main tab

h3. Suggested resolution

Show the field in a tab as per screen configuration (regardless if it's added in Request form)
fields.summary: Show fields in a tab as per screen configuration

fields.description:
Hello!  I'm reaching out to see if the following features are available, or could be added in the future for Jira Service Management:
 * Merging Like Issues (same customer emails twice about same issue, merge them together into a single issue)
 * Customer Note Field(s) (for reference on particular customer for future requests)
 * Engaging 3rd Party (forward issue to 3rd party within ticket to see engagement/replies)
 * Canned Responses (Custom responses that can be added to a reply to a customer without copy/paste from another document source)
 * Setting Customer on Forwarded Emails (automatically set customer on issue based on email used in original email, i.e. not the person who forwarded it in.  This would be helpful when customers reach out directly to outside emails and we want to create a ticket for that customer in the service desk).

 

Let me know if you need any other information.

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Feature Requests

fields.description:
Currently we have smart values to access information from Affected Services but *we are missing the smart value to access the Affected Services used by an Affected Service*. 


Currently available smart values for Affected Services can be found here:
https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-general/
fields.summary: As an admin I need to access the Affected Services used by in Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Executing a portal transition after logging work on a ticket creates an Original Estimate update entry on the issue history.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure a [Customer Facing transition|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/configuring-the-customer-portal-939926277.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-Addtransitions].
# Create a ticket
# As an Agent, log work on the ticket.
# As the customer, execute the transition from the portal.

h3. Expected Results

- The issue is transitioned.

h3. Actual Results

- The issue is transitioned and the "Original estimation" is changed on the ticket

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: Executing a portal transition performs an update on the Original estimate field
